English .
New-York Historical Society
Robert Hunter Papers MS 316
0.5 Linear feet (1 box)
1699-1744 (bulk 1710-1744) Robert Hunter was a colonial governor of New York and New Jersey. His papers include correspondence, accounts, and legal documents.
Access Restrictions
Open to qualified researchers.
Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to twenty exposures of stable, unbound material per day. (Researchers may not accrue unused copy amounts from previous days.)
Use Restrictions
Permission to quote from this collection in a publication must be requested and granted in writing. Send permission requests, citing the name of the collection from which you wish to quote, to:
Manuscripts Curator
The New-York Historical Society
170 Central Park West
New York, NY 10024
Preferred Citation
This collection should be cited as Robert Hunter Papers, The New-York Historical Society.
Biographical Note
Robert Hunter was born in Edinburgh, Scotland 1666. He was appointed governor of New York and New Jersey, arriving in June of 1710. Hunter left New York and New Jersey in 1719, exchanging positions with William Burnet, the comptroller of customs. In 1727 he was appointed governor of Jamaica, where he died in 1734.
Scope and Content Note
This collection includes personal and official accounts; bills of lading; receipts; letters of administration issued by Governor Hunter; powers of attorney; leases; complaints issued in suits against debtors; bills of exchange; bonds; a few items of correspondence; and a group of later legal documents pertaining to the affairs of Robert Orby Hunter, particularly to his suit against Peter Schuyler.
Individual documents include a list of warrants, bonds, conveyances, and papers left in the hands of Abraham De Peyster, 1719; accounts pertaining to the repair, rental, and leasing of houses and property in Amboy, New Jersey; and a 1720 valuation of Hunter's household goods at Amboy. Individuals mentioned or involved in Hunter's affairs include his attorney, James Alexander, John Barclay, and William Burnet.
Arrangement
The collection has been arranged into folders by type of material. Items within the folders are arranged chronologically.
Receipts (financial records) Powers of attorney Letters of administration Legal instruments Debt -- New York (State) Land grants -- New Jersey. New York (State) -- Politics and government -- To 1775. Perth Amboy (N.J.) Accounts. Bills of lading. Bonds (legal records). Complaints (Civil procedure) Correspondence. Inventories Leases. Legal documents. Alexander, James, 1691-1756 Barclay, John, active circa 1700-1740 Burnet, William, 1688-1729 Hunter, Robert Orby Schuyler, Peter Walbo, Richard Eagle (ship)
